title: Drawing, "Funeral Decorations for King Louis XVI of France"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
inscribed:
Inscribed in pen and brown ink on the shaft: LVIGI XVI
At the lower right: non compres
Scale at bottom.
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. A variation of 1938-88-1303, the door frame being somewhat similar to 1938-88-1337. The panels beside the door openings are decorated with a festoon supported by lion masks. The pedestal is shorter and has a greater diameter. In the acroteria are heads. On top is a classical warrior raising with his left hand a chalice with the Host above. Alternative suggestions are made for the candelabra. Inside as 1938-88-1301. The lateral pillars similar to 1938-88-1288 with one section of the entablature more.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Funeral Decorations for King Louis XVI of France".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1287.
